identificationModule.briefTitle: The Prevalence of Sarcopenia in a Cohort of Haemodialysis Patients and Its Correlation With Mortality
identificationModule.officialTitle: The Prevalence of Sarcopenia in a Cohort of Patients With End Stage Kidney Disease on Haemodialysis Patients and Its Correlation With Mortality

responsibleParty.investigatorTitle: Associate professor of Internal medicine and nephrology

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The study aims to explore the correlation between the prevalence of sarcopenia and one year mortality amongst patients on maintenance hemodialysis
descriptionModule.detailedDescription:
In our study , we aim to explore the correlation between the prevalence of sarcopenia and one year mortality among patients on maintenance hemodialysis The lean muscle mass was measured using bio-impedance analysis (BIA ). The hand-grip test was used to measure the function .

Sarcopenia was defined using European Working Group on Sarcopenia in Older people (EWGSOP) definition which involves reduced muscle function and reduced muscle mass

keywords: dialysis dependent end stage renal disease

designInfo.interventionModelDescription: This is cohort prospective study of end stage kidney disease patients on hemodialysis

armGroups.label: End stage kidney disease patient on maintenance hemodialysis
armGroups.description: All patient that have been recruited with have the lean body mass index measured sing the Bio-impedance analysis ( BIA )
interventionNames: Diagnostic Test: Hand grip function testing

interventions.name: Hand grip function testing
interventions.description: The use of Bio-impedance to measure the skeletal muscle mass
armGroupLabels: End stage kidney disease patient on maintenance hemodialysis
otherNames: Measuring skeletal body mass using bio-impedance analysis ( BIA)

primaryOutcomes.description: All cause mortality of patients with end stage kidney disease on hemodialysis

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Patients with End stage kidney disease on maintenance dialysis

Exclusion Criteria:

* unable to consent or terminal malignancy
